Top Pharmacy Colleges in India 2024: Ranking, Admission, Fees, Placements, Cutoff

There are 90+ top Pharmacy colleges in India, 50+ are private, whereas 30+ are government-owned and the remaining 1 is owned by semi-government institutions. Some of the best Pharmacy colleges in India are National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research, Jamia Hamdard, BITS Pilani, JSS College and many more. NEET, MHT CET, GPAT, AP EAMCET, CUET, JEE MAIN and KCET are some of the best entrance exams for admission to top Pharmacy institute in India.

LATEST UPDATES ON EXAMS:

  • MHT CET exam for BTech will be held between May 2, 2024 and May 16, 2024.
  • TS EAMCET 2024 exam for Agriculture & Pharmacy courses will be held onMay 7 and May 8, 2024.

  • GPAT 2024 registrations are open for admission to the MPharma course and the last date to apply is May 8, 2024. Further, the GPAT 2024 exam will be held on Jun 8, 2024.

  • KCET exam 2024 result will be released on May 20, 2024.  .

  • NEET 2024 will be held on May 5, 2024 and the result will be declared on Jun 14, 2024.

Top Pharmacy Colleges in India: Admissions 2024

Pharmacy courses can be pursued at Diploma, UG, PG and PhD levels. The eligibility criteria differ as per the course selected by the candidate. However, given below the broad eligibility criteria for Diploma, UG, PG and PhD Pharmacy courses for the reference of candidates:

  • Diploma (DPharma): Candidates must have passed Class 10 with Science subjects i.e. Physics, Chemistry, Biology and Mathematics.
  • UG level (BPharma): Candidates must have passed Class 12 with a combination of either Physics, Chemistry and Biology or Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured at least 50% aggregate score from a recognised board. The course is of four years duration.
  • PG level (MPharma): Candidates must have passed BPharma with at least 50% aggregate score from a pharmacy college as approved by the Pharmacy Council of India (PCI). The course is of two years- duration.

PhD level:

6-year Pharm D course:

  • Candidates must have completed class 12 from every state level of education from any state/national education board. They must have studied Physics and Chemistry as compulsory subjects with Mathematics or Biology as additional subjects. They must have completed 17 years of age in the year of admission.
  • Candidates holding a diploma in pharmacy are also eligible for Pharma D course provided they fulfil all other conditions.

3-year Pharm D course (Post Baccalaureate):

  • Candidates who passed the Bachelor of Pharmacy course from an institute recognized under the Pharmacy Council of India are eligible for Pharma D course.
  • They must have completed higher secondary education i.e. class 12 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics or Biology subjects.

Disclaimer: This information is sourced from official website and may vary.

Popular Exams Accepted by Best Pharmacy Colleges in India

For top pharmacy institute in India, Candidates need to qualify for some exams and they are:

  • NEET: The National Eligibility and Cumulative Entrance Test (NEET) is the only entrance exam in India for MBBS and BDS admission. The exam lasts three hours and 20 minutes and is administered offline once a year. For admission to MBBS, BDS, BSc Nursing, BAMS, Veterinary, and other medical/paramedical schools in India, the National Testing Agency (NTA) administers the medical entrance exam. On May 7, the NEET exam will take place. 13 languages are used to administer the test.
  • MHT CET: Maharashtra Common Entrance Test is a state-level entrance test used to select applicants for admission to engineering and pharmacy programs at various colleges throughout Maharashtra.

FAQs

Q. Which are the top Pharmacy colleges in India?

A. As per NIRF Ranking, the following is a list of Top Pharmacy colleges in India ranked by NIRF in the past three years:

College Name

NIRF 2021

NIRF 2022

NIRF 2023

National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research, Hyderabad

2

1

Jamia Hamdard

1

1

2

BITS Pilani

3

3

JSS College of Pharmacy

7

6

4

Institute of Chemical Technology

5

7

5

Q. Which are the most popular exams accepted by Top Pharmacy colleges in India?

A. The most popular exams accepted by Top Pharmacy Colleges in India are NEET, MHT CET, AP EAMCET, GPAT, JEE Main, etc. NEET is ticket to many colleges like Institute of Chemical Technology (ICT), Poona College of Pharmacy, Bharathi Vidyapeeth, Birla Institute of Technology Mesra, Shoolini University, AISSMS College of Pharmacy, Gurunank College of Pharmacy whereas MHT CET is ticket to many colleges like Y.B. Chavan College of Pharmacy, Gurunanak College of Pharmacy.  

Q. Which are the most popular specialisations accepted by Top Pharmacy colleges in India?

A. The specialisations offered by top Pharmacy colleges in India are Pharmaceutical, Pharmacology, Biotechnology, Post Baccalaureate, Quality Assurance etc. 

Q. How many top Pharmacy colleges are there in India?

A. .There are 92 Top Pharmacy colleges in India. Out of which 66% are Private, 33% of Public and 1% of Public Private. Pharmacy is a Science that links Medical Sciences with Chemistry. This field of Health Science plays an enormous role in the testing, discovery, production, research and use of medicines and drugs. The Pharmacy courses in India provide the students with an understanding of different aspects of medicines, drugs, chemical structure, formulation, etc. Pharmacy courses are a gateway to the Healthcare and Medical industry

Q. Are there any job opportunities after Pharmacy in India?

A. Yes, there are several job opportunities for students who complete Pharmacy from India. Some of them are listed below:

  • Pharmaceutical Scientist
  • Pharmacy Manager
  • Medical Writer
  • Drug Inspector
  • Pharmaceutical Financial Analyst
  • Clinical Research Associate
  • Quality Control Associate
  • Pharmaceutical Sales/Marketing Executive
  • Pharmacist
  • Retail Pharmacist

Q. What are the skill sets required for studying Pharmacy courses?

A. Aspirants who wish to pursue a career in the Pharmaceuticals industry must have the following skill-sets:

  • Medicinal and scientific research skills
  • Communication skills and interpersonal skills
  • Adaptation ability
  • Therapeutic and counselling skills
  • Medical writing and ethics
  • Business skills such as marketing and organising
  • Curiosity and persuasive skills

Q. Which state is best for Pharmacy colleges in India?

A. There are almost 100 Top Pharmacy colleges in India. Out of which, Maharashtra has the maximum number of top Pharmacy colleges in India. Some of the best colleges in Maharashtra are Institute of Chemical Technology (ICT), Poona College of Pharmacy, Bharathi Vidyapeeth, Bombay College of Pharmacy, Y.B. Chavan College of Pharmacy, AISSMS College of Pharmacy.

Q. Which pharmacy colleges has highest placement in India?

A. The college has the best placement for Pharmacy in India tabulated below with average placement package:

College Name Average Placement Package
PU INR 4.50 LPA
BITS, Pilani INR 10 LPA
JSS College of Pharmacy, Ooty INR 7.80 LPA
Institute of Chemical Technology INR 7.60 LPA

Q. What is the future scope of B Pharma?

A. After completing the course, B Pharmacy graduates might opt to work or further their education. Students can choose from a variety of B.Pharmacy careers based on their experience and performance, including Research Officer, Research and Development Executive, Medical Researcher, and Clinical Trial Scientist, among many more. B Pharmacy graduates might find work in both the public and private sectors.

Q. Which is the best college of B Pharmacy in India?

A. The institutes are best for Pharmacy are listed below:

  • Jamia Hamdard
  • National Institute of Pharmaceuticals Education and Research
  • Panjab University
  • BITS Pilani
  • JSS College of Pharmacy Ooty 

Q. Which are the top 5 B pharmacy colleges in India?

A. The top 5 pharmacy colleges in India are listed below:

  • National Institute of PharmaceuticalEducation and Research, Hyderabad
  • Jamia Hamdard
  • BITS Pilani
  • JSS College of Pharmacy
  • ICT
